SENT.plain: Vascular anomalies, extracranial and intracranial arteriovenous malformations as well as glomus jugulare tumour are well known causes of pulsatile tinnitus
Of late, benign intracranial hypertension has been stated to be a more common cause
However, tinnitus arising from and within the internal jugular vein has been reported only infrequently
Previously known as cephalic bruit and essential objective tinnitus, the venous hum tinnitus presents as pulse synchronous unilateral objective tinnitus
Ligation of the internal jugular vein appears to be a successful treatment
